----- Original Message -----
From: McGraw, T. David <Mcgraw.Thomas@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, August 17, 1999 9:35 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Glowing Stein -- SEMI SPOILER


> From: "McGraw, T. David" <Mcgraw.Thomas@...>
>
> The quest starts in Ogguk. It isn't difficult for a wizard to get all
of
the
> components BUT you have to have a 20+ level enchanter in order to
complete
> the quest. Also you can not receive the quest(unless you are a darkie,
in
> which case you can't get the next step in Freeport) because the ogres
will
> kill you on sight. Basically the quest goes like this...
>
> You talk to a bartender in Ogguk and he says he is missing his recipe
> book(or some such nonsense) and that he gave it to a bartender in
Freeport.
> You go to Freeport and talk to the bartender on the docks and he says
he
is
> trying to make some wonderful drink and that if you get him the items
he
> will give you the book back. He wants 4 things. A kiola nut from OOT,
JumJum
> Juice from Rivervale, Fish Scales from Qeynos, and 1 thing from Erudin
which
> I forget right now. Anyway after you collect all of these things you
return
> them to him and IF your faction is high enough you get the NO DROP
> compendium(this is why you have to have an enchanter because you have
to
> have good standing with both Freeport and Ogguk). After you get the
book
> return in to the ogre and you will get the coveted glowing stein. This
is
a
> rather crude over view of the quest but it really is pointless unless
you
> know a trustworthy enchanter. Even if you offer 100 platinum to a
stranger
> you could get ripped because the stein is currently going for around
750
> platinum(I am SOOO glad I know a friendly enchanter). Now if you are
friends
> with an enchanter this a good way to make money because, as a wizard,
you
> can collect the items and the enchanter can finish the quest. All told
about
> 3 hours work for 750 plat, not too bad.
>
> Hope this helps.
>
> Yours,
>
> ~Aereuss Ravins of Tarew Marr
>
>
>
